alert.note: Alert for Mobile (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 28 at 11:52AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Alabama, including the following county, Mobile. * WHEN...Until 145 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1150 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen and additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible over the area. This, combined with already saturated soils, will likely result in minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tillmans Corner, Theodore, Bayou La Batre, Coden, Irvington, Saint Elmo, Laurendine, Meadow Lake, Dixon Corner, Fowl River, Dawes and Kirewakra. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
